f6_assessments.q0: The project is very well documented with details information. Miverse concept and game design looks attractive and promissing to retain players with the game. I agree with proposers that many NFT games are not having good art and graphic design and just mimic traditional game idea. I have a strong belief the team can create nice NFT games in their multimerve design that have considerable contribution to growth of Cardano ecosystem. To make the game more attractive and entertaining to players, I would suggest the team to  add the regular daily, weekly missions with rewards to players, allow players to form their team to fight with others.
f6_assessments.q1: According to provided link to project team profile, they have successfully developed many game projects with millions of users. The previous games art design looks attractive and professional. They just launched the first NFT game last year and  I have a strong belief the team can create another successfully NFT game in this project and has a considerable contribution on Cardano ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q2: The timeline of the project is from QII 2022 until QI 2023 with detailed explanation of tasks need to be completed per quarter. The provided roadmap is clear and KPIs are appropriate to judge the success of the project. The cost breakdown are well documented with very detailed information to verify.

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem that the proposal team wants to improve is to create quality NFT games, attract players, and remove prejudices about NFT games among gamers. The solution is to make higher quality and fun games to really enjoy and entertain, not only for only earning. I think this is an interesting idea and has the potential to attract a large number of users to the Cardano ecosystem.
The presentation of the problem of the proposal team is very clear and detailed. This gives the viewers a clear overview of the issues covered in the proposal. The explanation of the project's concept also allows the viewers to visualize the project's image. The proposers have identified the main components of the project. The object that the project aims to be concretized is Play-to-entertain gamers. The plans are also to attract these audiences. The Solution section of the project is divided into small sections and presented very easily. The way the project works is also described in great detail, showing the impact of the project on potential audiences.
The project promises to produce results in phases. The proposed stages are presented in detail for each goal. The project's and the proposal's KPIs are also in sync with the key metrics of the challenge and also explain this matching.
Overall, the project team identified 5 main challenges. Each challenge has provided a solution. With this proposal alone, the team also plans for the risks that may be faced in the near future with well-prepared solutions. The presentation of the challenges is also easy to understand thanks to the logical division into two parts.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal team has attached a very detailed roadmap for the project implementation plan. In addition, a summary of the project implementation plan is provided. The viewers can easily assess the progress of this project. Corresponding to milestones and timelines, categories are logically divided with clear quantitative indicators. The community can rely on these metrics to track project progress.
The budget plan for the third quarter of 2022 is divided into marketing & graphic development, or comic development. The proposed budget is quite reasonable with the general plan. The spending plan is presented in tabular form. Items to be invested are listed specifically with appropriate spending levels.
This project is jointly implemented by 3 companies in 3 important areas contributing to the project construction. The team leading the project includes members with extensive experience as well as specialized knowledge and skills. Their profile provides the necessary information to be trusted to bring the project to completion according to plan and goals.
f6_assessments.q2:
Quantitative indicators are clearly stated in the attached files so that the community can easily assess the success of the project and check the progress of the project regularly. However, if possible, please present the quantitative indicators for this proposal in a concise manner so as to be less confusing when viewing the attached file.
The image of a successful project is clearly shown from the project's achievements. The goals fit very well with the blueprint. Proposers also provide additional proposals related to the project. This shows that the team is very serious about implementing the set goals.

f6_assessments.q0:
Miverse is taking the opposite route to other NFT gaming projects that are more like a money grab and no fun.This is an important aspect of gaming always missed in most on-chained gaming proposals and this proposal touched on this problem highlighting the intentions behind the proposal which is gamer-centric.
I also love as it addresses the false narratives by so many NFT game projects that the Total Addressable Market is 2.9 Billion meanwhile we the mainstream gamers hate crypto games because they are mundane, again this shows the focus of this proposal compared to other on-chained game proposal.
The proposal gave a detailed breakdown of their activities with a provided link to read about the lore , mechanics, art etc.
This proposing team did a great job in this impact section and kudos to them.
I don't have much to say, i am giving 5 star as this project will attract gamers to cardano and help expand the community.
f6_assessments.q1:
assessing this section of the proposal will look lazy because this proposal has written down almost everything by providing a detailed roadmap, cost breakdown and timelines but i feel the requested amount of $137417 is kinda too high if you compare it to the total funding pot of $500000. If i am permitted , i will suggest that the team can apply for funding for each phase which will lower the requested amount drastically and gives this proposal a much better chance of being funded considering other proposals in this challenge.
I will be giving 5 star as the proposal satisfied every request for this section according to the CA guidelines.
f6_assessments.q2:
As stated earlier , due to the amount of information packed in this proposal  it makes assessing it look lazy because this proposal provided every information with links to more materials to successfully audit this proposal to completion.
I really hope this project gets funded as one can see the hard-work put into just this proposal.
I am giving 5 star.

f6_assessments.q0: The "Metaverse of Play-to-Entertain Gamer" proposal addresses the Gamers on-chained well by focusing on Play-to-Entertain gamer. They perceive Play-to-Earn gamers preference towards NFT games is sustainable. The Play-to-Entertain group prefers other game types to the NFT games. The team prefers not to sell NFT assets in early phases of game development. The links the team provided for their Miverse concept and future work don't work properly. However, the concept is well understood that the Play-to-Entertain Gamer preference will make the game growing sustainably as there are stable number of Transactions to Miverse and Cardano. The impact of their solution is clear but it will improve the proposal to ensure that the information can be easily accessed to view the current and future plans.
f6_assessments.q1: Although they have another proposal sitting on this challenge, this proposal requests the budget for game and technical development (another proposal requests budget for art development). The working hours should be specified so that the community can know if $3000 per senior developers work is well worth it. Also it is rather odd that the senior artist (in another proposal) will earn the same rate as the senior developer in this proposal. The team is comprised of entrepreneurs which are good qualified professionals in gametech. If the proposal can be improved with more transparency in budget and the synergy between 2 proposals.
f6_assessments.q2: When clicking on the link of their official website, www.miverse.com. The links shows the clothing company so it could be that the official site listed in the proposal is wrong or the official site does not exist yet. The proposal will improve their score in auditability if the link to their main site is correct. Only a few information sets obtained from this proposal are budget related  and their roadmaps. The more ambitious the project, the clearer it needs to be able to audit the project. It is helpful that they provide their target number to accompany their metrics which are 3 communities, 500 members in each community and 2,000 followers in social media account. The proposer understand the game space pain point and has proposed solution with goal aligned well with the Gamer on-chained challenge.
f6_assessments.reply:
IMPACT 
I think the comment that reduces our rate is the last sentence of the comment, but that's unfair because all of our attached links were public at the start. More than that, the detailed content of this proposal is enough to provide the current and future plans that they want to know, including the goals, the concept of the whole business that we provided at the beginning of this proposal, components in our project in the solution section... so I think that the assessor didn't read it carefully. 
FEASIBILITY 
We calculate our workload mostly on the man-hour, man-month and taking the salary of $3.000 at the average rate for a senior developer. This is the way any professional game house will do to assess the workload to their client. More than that, not just summarize the budget in the limited space of this proposal, we also attached a detailed file to show them in detail, and also show the relationship between our proposals. All of them are transparent that even the community can use other professional game studios to assess it. But the assessor judged that it was not enough. So I think the assessor just assesses without any reasonable evidence but just feeling. 
Moreover, the assessor should show more info to tell voters how much feasibility our proposal is with other components. But he just focused on our budget only, with unreasonable comments. 
AUDITABILITY 
The last thing for me to suggest filtering out this assessment is that they didn't read carefully our content. We attached the link to tools to help the community track and trace our progress that I believe many other assessors saw - also the content point to the link clearly is "in the link here." But the assessor didn't care about it in his comment. That link can help him know that our provided link in the proposal is wrong and fixed in it. 

Overall, I believe that this assessor is not reading the content carefully enough to assess our proposal. And also provide some nonsense comments to help assess our proposal to help voters make accurate decisions.
